page.title: 05The Canal Today
page.content: Sefton Council has a plan to develop the canal and its towpaths as a local amenity.In conjunction with a government urban aid programme the concil and British Waterways are investigating schemes to improve canal side buildings and to landscape the towpaths.Work has already begun near the bridge at Bells Lane,Lydiate. The canal is already well used by narrowboat enthusiasts and there is a boating club in Lydiate.During the fishing season the towpaths are crowded by local enthusiasts and many others from the surrounding area.Kenny Madine,a 2nd year pupil at Maghull High School,describes the trials and tribulations of canal fishing on the following page.
